Somehow their antagonism had rubbed off onto their circles of friends, leading to conflict whenever their paths crossed - usually at some sporting event. Both boys were natural sportsmen and had ended up as captains of their respective high-school soccer teams. At that point their aggression had become more formalized, partly sublimated in the rough and tumble of the match, and partly in the forfeits they began to introduce to motivate themselves and their teams...

* * * * * * * *

It had been an hard-fought match between two teams well-known for the bad blood between them. The ragged collection of observers had come expecting a fight and they hadn't been disappointed by the ill-tempered battle, filled with insults, heavy tackles, and downright fouls. The match was finally decided by a narrow margin after injury time with a victory for the home team, and the two mud-spattered, sweaty teams made their way off the pitch with an almost-palpable tension still blighting the air around them. But as the small crowd of observers slowly dispersed they had no idea that the real drama was about to begin - inside the lockerroom...

Ty and Sean stood almost nose-to-nose, glaring at each other with their team-mates at their backs. The air around them was humid with sweat and testosterone. Sean might have lost, but that didn't mean he'd act like it. He knew that Ty would make the most out of the situation - just as he would have done - and look for any opportunity to humiliate him further. At six-foot tall, with cropped blond hair, deep blue eyes and a powerful frame, Sean was used to being looked-up-to by other guys, drooled over by the girls, and feared by the geeks. He had an image to maintain and wasn't going to let Ty spoil it.

Ty's lips twitched in a crooked grin. "Actually it's pretty simple. Since we overwhelmed you with our superior talent on the football pitch I think it's only fair that you worship our feet."

Ty himself reached into his bag and pulled out what looked vaguely like some kind of camera - Sean couldn't recall seeing anything quite like it before, but supposed it must be some new advanced model; he knew Ty's Dad worked for a hi-tech research company or something similar. He watched as Ty pushed a button on the top, causing several lights to blink and a circular cover on the front to iris open, revealing what Sean presumed to be a lens. Then the device was raised and pointed directly at him.

"Let's just take a nice picture of the losing team first of all. Move back a bit so that I can get you all in here... that's it... now get on your knees and close your eyes..."

info.brief_description: A bet between two school soccer teams leads to one of them shrinking to a tiny size...
info.description:
Testing the waters with my first interactive... Exploring what happens when a teenager and his friends get the opportunity to shrink their rivals and have complete power over them.

RULES - pretty much the usual stuff:

- Check spelling and grammar.
- Try to avoid short chapters of less than a paragraph. I'll remove stuff that's blatantly too short or too lazy.
- Feel free to introduce the occasional minor character and to develop the existing ones (the players have deliberately been left vague), but pay most attention to interaction between the teams.
- Respect the work of other writers and don't contradict events in previous chapters (unless there's a very good reason)

Apart from that, go nuts and have fun!
